You know they say that I died in 1921, but actually <@252228069434195968> keeps me alive in a jar of formaldehyde in his server basement.

Here's my favourite drink, usually the crowning touch on my intoxication. Thread carefully with it: ```fix
_____ Minttu Kakáo _____
- 3 cl Minttu (Peppermint or Black Mint)
- 2 cl Disaronno Amaretto (this makes the drink fancier than it has any right to be)
- 1 bag of Rett i Koppen Sjokoladedrikk
- 2 dl boiling water
- 0.5 tsp cinnamon
- 0.25 tsp cardamom
Put everything in a large Moomins™ cup in the given order and continuously mix with a teaspoon. Drink it while it's hot!```
I may or may not have had a crush for Elsa Laula Renberg before I met my wife.

I think fondly of the days when Anders Larsen and I collaborated as editors for *Sagai Muittalægje*. I wonder if people still remember that one musical composition I published in the April 1906 issue of the newspaper.

My contemporary, Anders Larsen, published a novel named *Bæivve-Alggo*. The book may on the surface appear like a cliché-ridden lovestory according to modern standards but its motif of trusting in ones self-worth with equanimity while being a member of discriminated minority-group makes it as timely today as it was back in 1912. A work of art that has grown out of necessity will forever remain good.
